|Black's king is in check by the rook. }}

In games such as chess, shogi, and xiangqi, a 'check' is a threat to capture the
king (or general in xiangqi) on the next move turn. A king so threatened is said
to be in check. On the very next move, the player whose king is in check must
remove their king from check ("get out of check"), if possible. Either the
threat must be stopped (by interposing a piece between the threatening piece and
the king, or capturing the threatening piece) or the king must be moved to a
square where it is no longer in check. If the player has no move out of check,
the game ends in checkmate and the player loses.
